thread.title: No Comcast house calls during pope's visit
thread.title_full: No Comcast house calls during pope's visit

title: No Comcast house calls during pope's visit
text:
Staff Report Posted: Friday, September 11, 2015, 1:17 PM 
Comcast/Xfinity is informing its customers that it will not make any installations or in-home service calls in Philadelphia from Friday, Sept. 25, through Monday, Sept. 28, due to security measures and traffic restrictions for Pope Francis' visit. 
The company says it will have personnel and equipment in key locations to deal with other problems during the visit and said customers could still call 1-800-Xfinity (1-800-934-6489) at any time to report problems. 
In addition, customers can access self service options online at xfinity.com or through its MyAccount app on iOS and Android devices, the company said. 
Customer are urged to call the 800 number as soon as possible to schedule installations or in home service visits before Sept. 24.
